          Bio
          I’m a Ph.D. student at SUNY ESF studying forest carbon mapping and monitoring under Dr. Colin Beier. My work focuses on methods for leveraging open data to produce maps of forest structure at local scales relevant to management. I have an extensive background in programming and computer science, and have been learning to couple these skills with statistical inference and machine learning techniques to produce landscape-level insights. I enjoy the challenges that come with wrangling all kinds of spatial data using R and python.
          
          
          Education
          SUNY College of Environmental Science & Forestry | Syracuse, NY
          Ph.D. in Environmental Science | August 2019 - Present
          Tufts University | Medford, MA
          B.S. in Computer Science | August 2013 - May 2017
          
          
          Experience
          Research Assistant | SUNY ESF, CAFRI | August 2019 - Present
          Data Engineer | Lightkeeper, LLC | August 2017 - July 2019
